In "p2p: Functions to add/remove wtxids to tx reconciliation sets" 2e29e9beeebcadfc7afc56a28791456d40551bed: I think `MAX_SET_SIZE` could be in `txreconciliation.h` then we can use it in the tests.

```diff
-/**
- * Maximum number of wtxids stored in a peer local set, bounded to protect the memory use of
- * reconciliation sets and short ids mappings, and CPU used for sketch computation.
- */
-constexpr size_t MAX_SET_SIZE = 3000;
 
 /**
  * Maximum number of transactions for which we store assigned fanout targets.
diff --git a/src/node/txreconciliation.h b/src/node/txreconciliation.h
index c2cdf9875f..648b6369c0 100644
--- a/src/node/txreconciliation.h
+++ b/src/node/txreconciliation.h
@@ -14,6 +14,12 @@
 /** Supported transaction reconciliation protocol version */
 static constexpr uint32_t TXRECONCILIATION_VERSION{1};
 
+/**
+ * Maximum number of wtxids stored in a peer local set, bounded to protect the memory use of
+ * reconciliation sets and short ids mappings, and CPU used for sketch computation.
+ */
+constexpr size_t MAX_SET_SIZE = 3000;
+
 enum class ReconciliationRegisterResult {
     NOT_FOUND,
     SUCCESS,
diff --git a/src/test/txreconciliation_tests.cpp b/src/test/txreconciliation_tests.cpp
index a0071e4388..8befe0d36e 100644
--- a/src/test/txreconciliation_tests.cpp
+++ b/src/test/txreconciliation_tests.cpp
@@ -115,7 +115,7 @@ BOOST_AUTO_TEST_CASE(AddToSetTest)
     BOOST_REQUIRE_EQUAL(tracker.RegisterPeer(peer_id1, true, 1, 1), ReconciliationRegisterResult::SUCCESS);
     BOOST_CHECK(tracker.IsPeerRegistered(peer_id1));
 
-    for (size_t i = 0; i < 3000; ++i)
+    for (size_t i = 0; i < MAX_SET_SIZE; ++i)
         BOOST_REQUIRE(tracker.AddToSet(peer_id1, Wtxid::FromUint256(frc.rand256())));
     BOOST_REQUIRE(!tracker.AddToSet(peer_id1, Wtxid::FromUint256(frc.rand256())));
```

I've slightly extended the approach adding 3 commits to deal with short id collisions, which were not taken into account. Some of this may be squashable, I've added them separately for now so they are easy to diff/review.

I'm moving this to draft for now until I clean it a bit, plus get some feedback on the approach
